NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE REGIONAL DIRECTOR

Seattle, Washington
November 8, I960
Toi
Members of NAEB Television Board
From* Loren B. Stone, Chairman
Those of you who attended the recent meeting of the managers of stations
with NETRC at Palo Alto may recall toe discussion about problems of
labor contracts and toe desire expressed that information on existing
contracts and practices be exchanged between stations*
It was agreed that thismatter wasnot one affecting toe relationship of
toe stations with the Center and that it would be better to have toe
information pulled together under the auspices of the N&EB TV Board
than through the Center Affilliates* Committee*
I am in receipt of a letter from Jack McBride, who as chairman of the
NAEB TV Planning Committee passes along a request of that committee that
"as proposed at Palo Alto" the TV Board request Morris Novik, NAEB union
consultant to compile information and disseminate it to the stations*
It was not my recollection of the concensus of the Palo Alto discussion
that Novik was to be asked to do this job*
I am mindful of the furor created a few years b ack when information on
wage rates paid engineers was distributed to station engineers wa well as
to management, and had thought that since there still appears to be strong
feeling on the need to keep this exchange of information closely controlled
and exchanged solely between station managers, it might be desirable that
I, as chairman of the Television Board, personally undertake to gather
and distribute the information*
I would appreciate your suggestions as to how we should proceed*
Should the TV Board ask Morris Novik to prepare a summary of existing
contracts and practices among television stations?
Should the TV Board request the NAEB staff to prepare the information?
Should the TV Board itself, acting through its chairman, collect, compile
and distribute the information?
Any other suggestions?
ccs Bill Harley
